Text: Shout for joy to God, all the earth!
Context: The Psalmist begins with a call for universal praise to God.

Text: Sing the glory of His name; make His praise glorious.
Context: An exhortation to praise God for His glorious attributes.

Text: Say to God, ”How awe-inspiring are Your works! Your enemies cower before Your great strength.
Context: The works of God inspire awe and fear among His adversaries.

Text: All the earth bows down to You; they sing praise to You, they sing praise to Your name.“
Context: Selah
column7: The whole earth is depicted as worshipping God.

Text: Come and see the works of God; how awesome are His deeds toward mankind.
Context: The Psalmist invites others to witness God’s great deeds.

Text: He turned the sea into dry land; they passed through the waters on foot. There we rejoiced in Him.
Context: Reflects on the miraculous crossing of the Red Sea.

Text: He rules forever by His power; His eyes keep watch on the nations. Let not the rebellious exalt themselves.
Context: Selah
column7: God is depicted as a sovereign and vigilant ruler.

Text: Bless our God, O peoples; let the sound of His praise be heard.
Context: An invocation for collective praise of God from all peoples.

Text: He has preserved our lives and kept our feet from slipping.
Context: Grateful acknowledgment of God‘s protection and support.

Text: For You, O God, have tested us; You have refined us like silver.
Context: God’s testing of His people is likened to the refining of silver.

Text: You brought us into the net; You laid a crushing burden on our backs.
Context: Recognition of the hardships imposed by God as a part of testing.

Text: You let men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water, but You brought us into a place of abundance.
Context: Describes the trials God‘s people endured before being brought to a place of plenty.

Text: I will enter Your house with burnt offerings; I will fulfill my vows to You—
Context: A vow to offer sacrifices in God’s house as an act of worship.

Text: the vows my lips promised and my mouth spoke in my distress.
Context: Undertaking the fulfillment of vows made during times of trouble.

Text: I will offer You fat animals as burnt offerings, with the fragrant smoke of rams; I will sacrifice bulls and goats.
Context: Selah
column7: A detailed description of the offerings to be made to God.

Text: Come and listen, all who fear God, and I will tell you what He has done for me.
Context: Inviting others to hear testimony of God‘s goodness.

Text: I cried out to Him with my mouth; His praise was on my tongue.
Context: Expressing how calling out to God resulted in praise.

Text: If I had cherished iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.
Context: The Psalmist acknowledges that harboring sin could have hindered God’s responsiveness.

Text: But God has surely listened; He has attended to the voice of my prayer.
Context: Gratitude for God‘s attentive response to prayer.

Text: Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer or His loving devotion from me!
Context: Exuberant praise for God’s ongoing attentiveness and love.
